Ich spiele dieses spiel sehr gerne aber wenn die Entwickler nicht etwas gegen diese "Camper" tun wird es nicht mehr gespielt.
Was ist daran spiel Spa√ü in den ersten 5 Minuten solange am Harken bewacht zu werden vom Killer bis man stirbt.

Das beruht auf Gegenseitigkeit der Community es gibt auch √úberlebende die, die Killer einfach nur Trollen und nerven damit der Rest die Genis machen kann.

Naja, ganz zum Spiel es macht ein Sehr gro√üen Spa√ü es hat viel Potenzial dieses spiel auch das die Entwickler immer wieder mal was neues Reinbringen in das Spiel das bringt frischen Wind hinein.

Doch sehe ich keine Zukunft f√ºr ein Vern√ºmftiges Miteinander wenn nicht eingegriffen wird von der Community oder dem "Support"
oder einfach etwas neues Reinbringt  wie z.b. Killer d√ºrfen nach dem Festharken sich nicht mehr im Umkreis von 42 Metern aufhalten sonst gibt es 10k Blutpunkte Verlust oder sonstiges. Klar dezent √ºbertrieben dennoch sollte man um dieses sehr gute Spiel zu retten einfach auf Ideen eingehen.

Im gro√üen und Ganzen Top spiel ich mag es auch wenn ich 6 Runden hintereinander Ungelogen nur Camper hatte bisher kann man von Durchhalten Sprechen aber auch das L√§sst mal nach.

Anmerkung: ich gebe disem Spiel keinen Daumen Runter nur wegen Camper es w√§re nicht fair.
Das spiel ist an manchen ecken verbesserungsw√ºrdig aber dennoch verdient es dieses spiel nicht aufgegeben zu werden.

Before you buy this, I want to let you know up front:

This game is exceptionally difficult, and if you're expecting to be able to master it with 10 hours of gameplay or less, I'd advise against buying it.

As a matter of fact, if you're not willing to invest 100+ hours MINIMUM into practicing at this, growing as a player and adapting to different strategies (regardless if you're playing Killer or Survivor), definitely do not buy this.

I don't say that because the game is bad or because it's not fun, it's actually a very fun game and winning is a very rewarding feeling. I say this because for those first 100 hours, you won't win very much and you are going to be very, VERY frustrated by the game's learning curve.

The game does have it's faults, but you can make the claim for most games. It's not perfect, and it can still be frustrating when you finally develop a respectable perk loadout and die as a survivor because somebody sandbagged or farmed you, or when you get no kills as the killer because a survivor spawned next to your totem (a serious feels bad moment, my condolences to you killer mains who deal with this), but winning in this game is a deeply satisfying experience that is well worth the frustration of the time it took to get there.

The community (for the most part) is very polite, very supportive, and chock full of great content creators on both Twitch and YouTube, so even if the game doesn't tickle you right away, you'll absolutely grow attached to the wonderful community around it (rich coming from me, seeing as I have become a pretty toxic player, but credit where it's due I suppose since a great deal of people I meet in DBD are amazing).

This game will make you angry. It's gonna aggravate you endlessly, and you're going to really, REALLY hate some of the players and mechanics at times, but if you want to be constantly challenged and make friends in a supportive community of like-minded players and creators, you won't find a better game for that $20 to be put into.
This game puts you in tension that is the grace
Quite the blast with friends bursting out laughing as we run away from eternal demise

Is it balanced? No.
Is it fun? Moderately, but take it with a grain or pound of salt.
are they going to fix anything? Absolutely not.

This is the video game equivalent of a roller coaster, and I don't mean that in a good way. I mean that as in you spend about an hour waiting in line wanting to die and hating yourself for even being there, before spending like 3 minutes having a pretty good time. The game is unbalanced, has way too many extra little "customizable" things for such repetitive actual gameplay, and is full of really annoying bugs. 

That all said, it's fun to die with friends, makes my heart beat like I've had too many Red Bulls, and I still keep playing.  

Would I recommend it? No.

Will I play with you if you buy it despite my lack of recommendation? Yup. ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø

I don't often review games, but the state of this game ... Releasing a paid DLC when a majority of the content is bugged or not working, pushing updates that make it impossible for people who have actual disabilities or health issues to be able to play, refusing to listen to community feedback that [i] they ask for [/i] & continuing to ignore major issues with game elements (hitboxes, hook bugs, broken perks) despite constant feedback and requests for change don't even scratch the surface of the issues here. I have never regretted game & DLC purchases so much as I do with this game and feel the need to send an apology to everyone I've ever gifted or recommend this game to.

I have lost many brain cells over this game. I first started when it came out on console, and it sucked me in. It's an extremely fun game which is made interesting by your teammates and/or your tactics as a killer. While this game has bugs, and can seem repetitive it's up to you to interpret it as you want. I do recommend this game however it is a much more enjoyable experience with friends.

From a logical standpoint, this game is probably the most stupid piece of shit you'll lay your eyes on. However, when you first play the game you don't realize how the game works and therefore find it fun. By 100-200 hours your trapped in a death vice before you even got a chance to escape it.

A very long, long time after my original thoughts on this game, I think it's changed enough that I can recommend it.

A lot of the gamebreaking bugs have been dealt with. A lot of the incredibly frustrating, match-shifting perks and items have been rebalanced to be far more tolerable. Groups of four survivors are far less common. And, they've been overhauling a lot of old killers and maps alike to bring them more in line with the newer chapters and content.

Given Behaviour's track record (primarily with Warhammer 40,000: Eternal Crusade and Deathgarden) I thought they were going to eventually leave the game to rot in an unfinished, buggy state, but they've pleasantly surprised me with continuous updates. Unfortunately, they do often put out updates that nobody really asked for or wanted (like the new HUD and animations), but they do eventually get sorted out by community response later.

I'd say to give it a go. On both sides you can play to just meme around and have fun, but you can also play to be oppressive and competitive if that's what you want.

Too many bugs... a lot of the times when i enter a match i get stuck on a loading screen and have to kill the process on task manager. 
Also, when you open the game it starts playing the cutscene. You can skip it but it`ll be there the next time you open the game... Over and over and over again. 
And it doesn`t load completely unless you "press the spacebar"... why??????? 

But those are just some annoyances... the game is pretty fun most of the times, but sometimes it bugs out and it's really frustrating. 

Once i got to the exit gate and passed the line where the game is supposed to let me leave... but i just kept goin and ended up running off the map, just to be sent back again.. i ended up losing because the time to escape ran out, even though i passed trough the exit gate completely. 

Anyways, i would recomend this game if you have friends to play, but know that it has loads of bugs....

With four survivors pitched against one killer, players' decision making skills are put to the test with immense pressure and limited information. Players are allowed to create unique play styles with flexible skill combinations on their favorite characters due to the teachable perk feature and a variety of items and helpful add-ons.

As a survivor, the players are required to perform tasks efficiently whilst maintaining a high state of awareness to their surroundings. Information on the killer's abilities and teammate's play style are to be deduced through trial and error with limited chances. Survivors are to decide the priorities between saving a teammate, completing objectives, or as they advance to a higher skill bracket - become a nuisance to the Killer. "Survive with Friends" (SWF) mode over voice comms is much less chaotic than going solo and would personally recommend for a fun night of screams and laughter.

As a killer, the ability to read player's movements becomes very important and allows for killers to create an intense game of hide and seek for the survivors. The killer is constantly under pressure as survivors rush to complete generators at different locations, and are alerted when the killer comes within range through various perks. Once a victim is found and caught, the killer is to make the decision as to whether the particular victim is worth their time to eliminate or there are higher priority targets that should be placed under stress. Killer mode is highly reommended for a gaming session to release the inner trickster and dwell into the sinister lore of licensed characters e.g. Myers, Freddy, Leatherface etc.

DLC is optional, however it is recommended that potential buyers purchase their familiar characters or the pretty ones for a better experience. Should a player wishes to progress into better skill builds, DLC becomes a necessity to unlock some advantageous perks or to min max certain particular play style. Though attaining teachable skill perks would require play time of up to 25 hours per character. For the collectors, most achievements are locked behind DLC pay wall. As such, purchase DLC at your own judgement based on your liking and play time allocation.

As of date of writing, there are no dedicated servers and all games are hosted P2P by the Killer, this in turn creates complications with ping latency and players are given the option to check their pings before committing to a match. Dedicated servers are confirmed by devs to be a upcoming feature after summer of 2019. The game UI is somewhat tedious to work with, as the double lobby matchmaking due to P2P issues utilizes Steam as the medium to invite friends. Players are required to constantly click on inconveniently placed buttons and return to main menu for lobby creation and invites. Stores are also tough to access during the 1-2 minutes long queue phases. Loading times are decent unless one of the players disconnected.

Along with a long list of licensed characters, good track record of updates and balancing, all in all guarantees a fun experience and value for money addition to your Steam library. 

P.S. Not sure if it was a memory leak but definitely quite taxing on my i5 Haswell CPU as it has triggered BSOD (CLOCK_WATCHDOG_TIMEOUT) a few times during sessions of 3+ hours.

NON e' un gioco perfetto, per√≤ non si pu√≤ considerare merda, √® un gioco niente male e personalmente il mio preferito, penso che il concept sia uno dei migliori mai creati nella storia dei videogiochi moderni e assolutamente meglio di un sacco di altri giochi secondo me, vale la pena un acquisto, specialmente se siete amanti del genere survival Horror o se preferite Horror arcade, se avete un po' timore dei giochi Horror non preoccupatevi, perch√© la natura Arcade di Dead by Daylight fa si che l'horror rimanga solo nell'atmosfera senza essere pauroso come altri giochi, purtroppo il gioco viene di molto sminuito dalla mancanza di server dedicati, ma gli sviluppatori hanno promesso di metterli durante l'estate 2019 (speriamo mantengano la promessa), il gioco √® un 1 vs 4 dove c'√® un Killer che deve uccidere 4 sopravvissuti appendendoli su dei ganci, lo scopo dei sopravvissuti invece √® quello di scappare dal Killer e di riparare 5 generatori in modo da poter aprire le porte elettriche, il gioco √® totalmente online, e la cosa che apprezzo di pi√π √® che ci sono dei killer e dei sopravvissuti presi da film cult dell'horror anni 90/2000, COME FREDDY KRUGHER, MICHEAL MYERS, LEATHERACE, SAW, GHOSTFACE, e sono sicuro che ne arriveranno altri, in conclusione gioco divertente e molto consigliato dal sottoscritto, BUON DIVERTIMENTO  ; )
